allow:
Bash(git commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
Fix Synapse signing key generation command

Fixed the error "Unknown execution mode 'generate_signing_key'" by using the correct command format for the Synapse Docker container.

Changes:
- Use ''generate'' command instead of ''generate_signing_key''
- Add proper environment variables \(SYNAPSE_SERVER_NAME, SYNAPSE_REPORT_STATS\)
- Add fallback method using Python inside container if primary method fails
- Add automatic detection and renaming of generated signing key files
- Provide helpful manual instructions if all automated methods fail

The script now tries multiple approaches to ensure signing key generation succeeds across different Synapse versions.

ðŸ¤– Generated with [Claude Code]\(https://claude.com/claude-code\)

Co-Authored-By: Claude Sonnet 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
\)")

Bash(git commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
Fix permission denied error when renaming signing key

Fixed "Permission denied" error when moving the generated signing key file.

Changes:
- Use Docker container to rename the signing key file \(preserves permissions\)
- Add ownership fix using chown or chmod as fallback
- Suppress errors with 2>/dev/null for cleaner output
- Add helpful warning if automatic rename fails
- Update manual instructions to mention renaming

The generated signing key file \(e.g., messaging.idfa.cc.signing.key\) is now properly renamed to matrix.signing.key inside the Docker container context to avoid permission issues.

ðŸ¤– Generated with [Claude Code]\(https://claude.com/claude-code\)

Co-Authored-By: Claude Sonnet 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
\)")
